result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky D Eddy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with Angelica Reichenbach, the victim.  No contact with known illegal drug users or dealers.
May apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation and has no more criminal convictions after this date.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant to be subject to random drug testing.  

Attend and successfully complete domestic violence court, if agent recommends.  

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

timeConds.notes: THIS IS A RESULT OF PROBATION REVIEW HEARING HELD ON 34/16.  AN ADDITIONAL 90 DAY JAIL SENTENCE ORDERED which started on 1/26/16.  If a bed becomes available after 75 days at the TLP, the remainder sentence can be stayed.  Not to sit longer than 90 days.  Credit for 38 days on this sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain employment acceptable to his agent.  Not to terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.  Obey all no contact orders of his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

records.addlTxt:
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No changes or corrections noted.  State recommended: For count one, 6 year total sentence, bifurcated as three years confinement, and three years of extended supervision. For count three  90 days confinement, concurrent to count one.  Consecutive to sentence serving in 16CF20.  439 days credit.  

Defense recommended: 18 months jail.  Concurrent with sentence serving in 16CF20.  Credit for 438 days.  

Court ordered:  For count one, 5 year total sentence, 24 mo bifurcated as  years confinement, and  3 years of extended supervision. For count three,   90 days confinement,  concurrent to count one.  Concurrent with sentence serving in 16CF20.  Not elgible for CIP & SAP.  Credit for 438.0  ES conditions.  Obtain and maintain employment approve by agent.   Not to term.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.  AODA and reco.  trtmt.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Obey all no contact orders of agent.  CC.

Waive reading.  Will plead no contest to count 1 and 3.  Victim notification complied with.
Court reviewed waiver of preliminary hearing with the defendant.  He understood.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a preliminary hearing.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Waiver of preliminary hearing form filed with court.  Joint recommendation for probation.  No contact with victim.  60 days jail.  Credit.  AODA. Court recited the charges and possible penalties of the charges he is pleading to.  He understands.  Plead no contest to counts 1 and 3.  Repeater allegations confirmed by court.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  He understood.  Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the pleas.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of counts 1 and 3.  Counts 2, 4-9 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Joint recommendation for 3 years probation.  No contact with A.R.  AODA, and recommended treatment.  60 days jail. Credit for 49 days.  s/m employment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact with known drug users.  May expunge if he successfully completes probation.    Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  

Court ordered: sentence withheld, 3 years probation, concurrent.   Conditions:  no contact with A.R., the victim.  AODA, and any recommended treatment.  60 days jail.  Credit for 49 days.  Seek and maintain employment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact with known illegal drug users or dealers.  Subject to random drug testing.  DV violence court, if agent recommends.   May apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation and no more criminal convictions after this date.  Court costs.  Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Status conference at 10-05-2015 03:00 pm.
